page.title: 07PERROTT'S BROOK FARM.
page.content: Perrott's Brook Farm is a dairy farm covering 155 acres and is owned by {Lord Bathurst.}The present tenant is Sir John Langman. It takes 3 minutes to milk 1 cow and 1.5 hours to milk all 80 Jersey cows. The milk then goes into a refrigerated tank which holds 260 gallons. The farm is well known for making yoghurt. The milk is heated to a temperature of 82c to eliminate the germs.It takes 2.5 hours to curdle then various fruit flavours are mixed in. The yoghurt is sold all over the South of England including{Harrods. The cows eat kale,hay or special animal food in the winter. They are worth Â£400 each. Female calves are kept as part of the milking herd. Sir John has no heir so the farm will return to Lord Bathurst when he retires.
